data.text:
The NRR Playbook: Why "Checking In" is Killing Your Growth üìâ
(a few more insights from the conversations I have around Customer Success).

If your CS team is spending 80% of their time on "at-risk" renewals, you don't have a success strategy‚Äîyou have a churn-prevention department.

High-growth SaaS companies don't just retain; they expand. This is where Certinia CS Cloud changes the game for CS Leaders focused on Net Revenue Retention (NRR).

Here is how a unified platform drives the numbers that matter:

‚úÖ Identify Expansion Signals Early: Certinia tracks product adoption and milestone completion in real-time. When a customer hits a "value peak," your CSM gets a prompt to discuss expansion, not just a renewal. 
‚úÖ Closing the "Value Gap": NRR climbs when customers see ROI. Certinia carries "Value Objectives" from the initial Sales deal through to Delivery. If you can prove you met the goal, the upsell conversation becomes a formality. 
‚úÖ AI-Powered Revenue Forecasting: Using Einstein AI, you can move from "guessing" your end-of-quarter retention to "knowing." Spot risk months in advance and deploy your pooled resources where they can save the most revenue. 
‚úÖ Cost-to-Serve Visibility: True NRR isn't just about the top line. By linking CS with PSA (Professional Services Automation), you can see exactly how much margin you‚Äôre spending to keep a customer happy.

Stop looking in the rearview mirror with siloed spreadsheets. To drive NRR, your Success data needs to live where your Revenue data lives: on Salesforce.
NRR is a team sport. Is your tech stack playing for the same side? ü§ù

#NetRetention #SaaSGrowth #CSStrategy #Certinia #RevenueOperations #CustomerSuccess

data.text:
I'm excited to share that I'm moving into a new global role at Certinia as Snr Sales Operations Manager, Technology & Innovation.

For the past 3.5 years, I've managed our BDR teams across EMEA and APAC. The current International BDR team has been incredible - the business acumen, growth mindset, and sheer tenacity they bring to their work have made this year a standout. Being part of their individual growth is immensely fulfilling.

To my team: your resilience and the way you've approached your work have been inspiring. You've challenged me to improve my support for you continually, and that's exactly what pushed me toward this next step.

I'm joining Onome's world-class GTM Ops org on Zach's Sales Strategy and Operations team, where I'll focus on our sales tech stack and the workflows that connect marketing, business development, and sales. 

Having lived the day-to-day alongside the team, I have a strong sense of where the opportunities are to improve efficiency and streamline processes. I've been keenly studying revenue operations, GTM systems, and how AI and automation can improve sales processes for the past five years, working toward eventually making this move. 

Thank you to Rob Harrison for your mentorship and for helping me find the courage to reach for what I wanted next for my career, and to Onome Militello and Zach Lewis for taking me seriously enough to give me this opportunity. I'm excited to work closely with everyone in this new capacity!

And with that, we're hiring a BDR Manager to support our awesome International BDR team! If you or anyone you know would be a good fit, applications will be up on our careers page shortly.

author.headline: GTM Ops Technology & Innovation | AI Champion

data.text:
What is the single biggest architectural challenge to securing your data?

Recent breaches have forced many in our industry to take a closer look at the invisible trade-offs in their tech stacks. The issue often is not with the platform itself, but with how data moves between systems.

External integrations have introduced a new class of vulnerability. They are the bridges attackers target. Increasingly, those bridges lead directly into systems of record.

The solution starts at the foundation. A solution natively built on a platform, like Certinia on Salesforce, ensures sensitive customer and business data stays within secure boundaries. That native approach is not only safer, but essential for trustworthy automation and #ResponsibleAI.

In my most recent Certinia blog post, I discuss what the latest breaches can teach us about designing for security.

I welcome your thoughts on this important topic: https://bit.ly/48Dii2v

data.text:
PSOs currently forfeit ~70% of potential revenue from their qualified pipeline‚Äînot because of a lack of sales, but the inability to mobilize qualified consultants fast enough.

The traditional pyramid model, built on a finite supply of human talent, cannot scale to meet today‚Äôs demand.

The solution is Autonomous PSA.

In our recent white paper with Constellation Research, Inc., Raju Malhotra and R "Ray" Wang detail the shift to a hybrid workforce where human experts orchestrate AI agents to shatter the capacity ceiling.

This paper charts the course from a rigid staffing hierarchy to a scalable diamond model that expands capacity without headcount bloat. By handing off up to 90% of administrative workflows to autonomous agents, firms can finally address the market demand they currently ignore. This shift allows organizations to increase addressable pipeline capture from a mere 10-20% to as high as 80%.

Autonomous PSA represents a fundamental re-architecture of the services economy. Read the full report to see how it unlocks a trillion-dollar opportunity: https://bit.ly/3KSjaIG

#AutonomousPSA #ProfessionalServices #AI #Certinia #FutureOfWork

article.title: Deb Ashton's Five Research-backed Lessons for Professional Services CXOs to Lead in the New Services Economy
article.subtitle: linkedin.com

data.text:
What is blocking consistent growth for services businesses across APAC?

Internal friction. Disconnects between systems, teams, and data quietly wear down margins, stall delivery, and create friction at every stage.

Across a region with complex regulatory environments, multiple currencies, and rapid customer expectations, these inefficiencies hit harder.

The Ultimate Guide to Services Delivery Success details five common breakdowns I often see here in APAC:

Fragmented Data¬†‚û°Ô∏è Forecasting accuracy drops, and real-time visibility disappears

Revenue Leakage¬†‚û°Ô∏è Margin erosion occurs through scope creep and poor staffing decisions

Manual Processes¬†‚û°Ô∏è Teams slow down, opening the door to costly errors

Clumsy Customer Experiences¬†‚û°Ô∏è Trust and client retention damage sets in

Disconnected Tools¬†‚û°Ô∏è Project teams operate without essential, real-time context

A better foundation can manage it. World-class service delivery is possible when Sales, Delivery, Finance, and Customer Success share a single, unified platform.

Download the Guide Here: https://bit.ly/4qDWtIc

#APAC #ProfessionalServices #BusinessOperations

author.headline: Regional Vice President, APAC - Certinia

data.text:
The biggest obstacles to scaling your services business are not always external. The issues usually sit inside your operation.

Many professional services firms rely on disparate applications or systems not purpose-built for their needs. This lack of proper tools leaves most organisations underperforming.

We've identified the 12 most common and costly shortcomings that prevent services firms from delivering successfully and operating at a profit. Do any of these issues sound familiar?

1. No Single Source of Truth: Wide gaps persist between how project delivery, finance, and customer success manage the business, increasing the likelihood of errors.

2. Billing Disputes: When more than 2% of your bills are disputed, it signals a deeper problem with the inputs for your invoicing.

3. Inconsistent Financial Forecasts: Taking more than 24 hours to generate a financial report suggests an over-reliance on manual processes.
If your organisation shows three or more of these signs, your systems require an urgent upgrade.

Download our research note to see the complete list of The 12 Deadly Pitfalls¬†and discover how top firms solve these challenges to drive sustainable growth. 
https://lnkd.in/eKhQM6V3

#ServicesBusiness #Profitability

Just finished ‚ÄúThe AI-Driven Leader‚Äù by Geoff Woods as a free audiobook on Spotify.

Really appreciated the focus on strategic thinking while using AI as a thought partner to challenge assumptions and expand on possible solutions. A core message was to stop trying to AI before you actually think!

The frameworks around aligning AI with strategy and people first were practical and genuinely useful. Found myself wanting to scribble notes on the actionable bits for later, which is tricky when you‚Äôre listening in the car‚Ä¶ so I bought a physical copy.

Worth a read if you‚Äôre after a sensible approach to integrating AI into how you lead.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

author.headline: GTM Ops Technology & Innovation | AI Champion

data.text:
Serious question‚Äîhas your Professional Services Automation (PSA) solution actually delivered on its promises?Sticking with a system that isn't evolving with your business gets expensive fast. If your PSA has been quietly coasting for the last few years, it's time for a proper check-up. Here are a few questions to ask:

Has Profitability Improved? Look beyond good intentions. Have margins gone up? Is revenue leakage under control? Does leadership trust the data enough to forecast with confidence?

What's the Day-to-Day Experience Like? If teams are still exporting data to spreadsheets, something has broken. Are you stuck with high maintenance costs, clumsy integrations, and a support partner who has gone quiet?

Is It Built for What's Next? Your solution needs to support your next phase‚ÄîAI-readiness, dynamic resourcing, evolving service models. Operating on a static, basic setup is a problem.

Get the full checklist:¬†https://lnkd.in/e8TdEVfP you're not ticking all the boxes, let's talk. Certinia helps services businesses operate with certainty across the entire value chain, trusted by more than a million professionals worldwide.

#PSA #Profitability #CustomerExperience #ProfessionalServices

data.text:
Customers don't want to buy hours. They want to buy outcomes. Could AI agents be the key to finally getting professional service organizations on the path of outcome-based pricing?

In this AiThority.Com articile, I discuss¬† why the shift away from hourly-based billing is still such a nagging problem: fragmented data and systems, inconsistent context, and lack of visibility across the entire project lifecycle.

#AgenticAI can deliver real progress, but only when it runs on a connected platform,¬† the entire services value chain. Without that foundation, you get no real-time insight. You get no automation with certainty.

We're in a pivotal moment for service delivery. The firms that move now will deliver faster, build stronger client relationships, and capture market leadership.

Read the full piece here: https://bit.ly/42SpSUR
